Utterance: <synch>
Hi, welcome back! How have you been since our last session?
I've been okay, just the usual ups and downs.
That's understandable. Last time, we talked about your family and your relationship with your husband. Have there been any developments since then?
Well, we had a bit of a breakthrough. I decided to sit down with him and talk about the construction issues more calmly.
That sounds like a positive step. How did that conversation go?
It went surprisingly well! I expressed my concerns without being accusatory, and he actually listened.
That's great to hear! What do you think helped you communicate more effectively this time?
I think I approached it from a place of wanting to work together rather than blaming him. I focused on finding solutions instead of just pointing out what went wrong.
That’s a significant shift. How did he respond to that?
He was receptive. He admitted he should have listened to me and we came up with a plan to fix the issues together.
Excellent! It sounds like you both are working on strengthening your partnership. How does that make you feel?
It makes me feel relieved and hopeful. I really want us to be a team, especially as we navigate these home projects together.
Teamwork is essential in a relationship. Are there other areas in your life where you’d like to improve communication or collaboration?
Hmm, I think with my sons. Sometimes I feel like they don’t open up to me as much as I’d like.
That’s a common experience for many parents. What do you think is holding them back from sharing more with you?
I think they’re both busy with their lives and maybe they feel I won’t understand their struggles.
Have you considered sharing your own experiences to create a more open dialogue?
I haven’t really thought about that. I usually just listen and offer advice when they ask for it.
Sharing your own challenges might help them feel more comfortable opening up. Would you be willing to try that?
Yes, I think I will. I want them to know I’m here for them, no matter what.
That’s a wonderful intention. How do you feel about setting a goal for yourself regarding this?
I’d like to have at least one meaningful conversation with each of them this month.
That sounds like a great goal! What would you like to talk about with them?
I want to ask them about their dreams and any challenges they’re facing. I want them to feel they can share anything with me.
That’s a lovely approach. How do you plan to initiate those conversations?
I think I’ll invite them for dinner and create a relaxed atmosphere. Maybe I can share a personal story to break the ice.
That sounds like a solid plan. Remember to be patient, as it might take time for them to open up fully.
Yes, I understand. I’ll give them the space they need.
Great! Moving on, how have you been feeling about your own personal goals, like your weight management?
Ah, the yo-yo dieting. I’ve been trying to be more mindful, but it’s still a struggle.
Mindfulness can be a powerful tool. Have you practiced any specific techniques to help with that?
I’ve tried keeping a food diary, but I tend to forget to write things down.
That’s common. Would you be open to setting reminders or using an app to help track your meals?
That might work better for me. I’m always on my phone, so it would be easier to do it that way.
That’s a great idea! Also, how do you feel about incorporating some physical activity that you enjoy?
I love walking, especially in nature. I’ve been meaning to explore some local parks.
That sounds wonderful! How about setting a goal to walk in a new park once a week?
I like that idea! It’ll give me something to look forward to.
Perfect! You’re making some great commitments today. How do you feel about all these goals we’ve discussed?
I feel motivated. I like having a plan to work towards.
That’s fantastic! Remember, progress takes time, so celebrate the small victories along the way.
I will, thank you.
Before we wrap up, is there anything else on your mind that you’d like to discuss today?
I’ve been thinking about my mom again. It’s been a while since I reflected on her passing.
It’s completely normal to revisit those feelings. Would you like to share what’s been on your mind?
I just think about how she would have loved to see my sons grow up. I wish she could have been here for those moments.
That’s a beautiful sentiment. It sounds like you’re honoring her memory by being a good parent yourself.
Yes, I try to carry her lessons with me. I just wish she could see how far we’ve come.
It’s clear that you’re continuing her legacy through your own family. How does that make you feel?
It makes me feel proud and connected to her in a way. I want to make her proud.
I’m sure she would be very proud of you. Would it help to create a small ritual to honor her memory during family gatherings?
That’s a lovely idea. Maybe I can light a candle and share a story about her.
That sounds like a beautiful way to keep her spirit alive within your family. Would you like to do that during your next family dinner?
Yes, I think I will. Thank you for that suggestion.
You’re very welcome! I’m glad you’re finding ways to incorporate her memory into your life. Let’s check in on your progress in our next session.
Sounds good! Thanks for your help today.
Of course! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
